com.captainalm.lib.stdcrypt.encryption

Interface ICipherFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AESPasswordRfc2898CipherFactory

    public interface ICipherFactory
    This interface provides the ability to obtain a Cipher and get and set its settings.
    Author:
    Captain ALM

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cipherAttributesModified()
      Gets if the cipher settings attributes have been modified.
      javax.crypto.Cipher getCipher(int opmode)
      Gets a new cipher instance.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the cipher factory.
      byte[] getSettings()
      Gets the cipher settings as a byte array.
      int getSettingsLength()
      Gets the length of the settings byte array.
      byte[] getSettingsNoSecrets()
      Gets the cipher settings as a byte array without secrets.
      int getSettingsNoSecretsLength()
      Gets the length of the settings byte array without secrets.
      void setSettings(byte[] settingsIn)
      Sets the cipher settings using a byte array.

    • Method Detail

      • getCipher

        javax.crypto.Cipher getCipher(int opmode)
                       throws CipherException
        Gets a new cipher instance.
        Parameters:
        opmode - The Cipher Operation Mode (Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, Cipher.WRAP_MODE and Cipher.UNWRAP_MODE).
        Returns:
        The new cipher instance or null.
        Throws:
        CipherException - An Exception has occurred.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the cipher factory.
        Returns:
        The name of the cipher factory.

      • cipherAttributesModified

        boolean cipherAttributesModified()
        Gets if the cipher settings attributes have been modified. Resets the flag once checked.
        Returns:
        If the attributes have been modified.

      • getSettings

        byte[] getSettings()
        Gets the cipher settings as a byte array.
        Returns:
        The byte array of the settings.

      • getSettingsLength

        int getSettingsLength()
        Gets the length of the settings byte array.
        Returns:
        The length of the settings byte array.

      • getSettingsNoSecrets

        byte[] getSettingsNoSecrets()
        Gets the cipher settings as a byte array without secrets.
        Returns:
        The byte array of the settings without secrets.

      • getSettingsNoSecretsLength

        int getSettingsNoSecretsLength()
        Gets the length of the settings byte array without secrets.
        Returns:
        The length of the settings byte array without secrets.

      • setSettings

        void setSettings(byte[] settingsIn)
          throws CipherException
        Sets the cipher settings using a byte array.
        Parameters:
        settingsIn - The byte array to load the settings from.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - settingsIn is null.
        CipherException - An Exception has occurred.
